thread.title: Rescue dog alerts family to smoke in the house
thread.title_full: Rescue dog alerts family to smoke in the house | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Journal Staff Report /
title: Rescue dog alerts family to smoke in the house
text:
This German Shephard/Blue Healer rescue dog alerted its family to home fire in Albuquerque Thursday morning about 7 a.m. Fire officials did not immediately have the dog’s name.
A family’s adopted German Shepard/Blue Healer rescue dog began barking early Thursday morning, alerting and waking up household members to smoke in the dwelling just before smoke alarms sounded about 7 a.m. at 3806 Bonnie Ann NE in Albuquerque, according to the Albuquerque Fire Department.
Firefighters arrived quickly and extinguished the fire that was located in the bathroom ceiling and apparently caused by an electrical issue in the bathroom fan, fire department spokeswoman Melissa Romero said in a news release.
Firefighters were able to contain the fire to the bathroom ceiling and roof saving the rest of the home, she said. The family is not expected to be displaced.
Three occupants, two dogs and a parrot safely evacuated without injury thanks to the family rescue dog and the working smoke alarms, fire officials said.
As a reminder, AFD, BCFD and Red Cross have joined forces on a free smoke alarm distribution & install project. Any citizen in Albuquerque and Bernalillo County can apply for free smoke alarms by going to www.CABQ.gov/fire . The application deadline is Nov. 2nd.
